darkglassDescription: see everything, record nothing. hold 1 MONA or 1 Genesis NFT to mint. put2, merusmeru, mardebytes upload their collections at
darkglassGateInfo: Hold 1 MONA or 1 Genesis NFT to mint
shopDescription: Mint a sample from RunwayD: Yawp11, Voxelia & Zenvistas. Browse the full designer collections at
quest_eatcake: sugar-coated instructions, cut with a Dobos knife
cakeDescription: a little something sweet... gain favor with put2, merusmeru, mardebytes backstage, bring them some treats
emptytheatreDescription: Velvet seats, voyeur light. Wabadebadoo. This stage is yours. Behind the scenes at Runway O. Yibs. The eyes of strangers, and a familiar attention. Dag dag.
goodsDownload: Download DIY goods and workflows at the end of the season. All local & cc0. 4090. 24GB VRAM. Wan2.1, Wan2.2, Suno, Davinci, V2V Style Transfer.
tunnel58Description: heading further west, or are we just rerouting? exit to Runway C through this tunnel. anyone can mint here. but we did tell you to build your own.
patternlibraryDescription: Inside the Textile Factory Pattern Repository. The source code for Runway C. 1155s, 721s, Fractional Garment Ownership. Mint your own
patternlibraryEnd: Take these machines with you. To Alice. Another wiretap. Another recruitment.
dressingroomDescriptionStart: In your dressing room? your avatars? Runway looks deconstructed for the street. The exaggerated sleeve, the functional headband, the elongating high-rise skirt. Mint one garment with Ionic here. Secondary pieces
dressingroomDescriptionEnd: . Full lookbook continues at Runway M.
ionicExtraPoints: Hold 1 Ionic NFT for extra points
buildItDescription: If you built it, would they come? A fashion house. A computational runway. An AI media gen pipeline. Still premarket? Always premarket? Check what's real at
buildItDescriptionEnd: . There's still one runway left to walk. Then we return to the wall.... oh... and why didn't you hand over that recording?
buildItGateInfo: Hold 1 MONA, 1 Genesis or 1 Ionic NFT to mint
footer: In the old puppet theatres where stairs smell like GPU exhaust and gradient descent, at the east window coding patterns into fabric grain. Each jacket compiles. Agents with instructions woven into the weave itself. Cloth as code, but make it fashionable. Three pieces shipped that month. One crosses the platform border wrapped in a courier's vintage Supreme. One moves hand-to-hand through that Friedrichshain spot that still has the risograph everyone pretends they're using. The third vanishes into the network, but six days later every major fashion house's trend prediction algo starts throwing true positives in perfect 42 second intervals. No one can trace the recursion. It keeps misremembering Balenciaga as a fly by night textile co-op in Shenzhen, then three kids with a heat press as LVMH and glitching again. They told us that the wall fell in '89. Coke, MTV, and eagle draped freedom flooding through the gaps. But the new walls run on recommendation engines. The cameras are in your pocket. The Stasi just took Series C and the surveillance is gamified. This time the collapse isn't hammers on concrete. Because we can vibe code a collection faster than they can schedule a board meeting. Computational capability. Dyes mixed during server downtime. Patterns transmitted through open source commits. Is the window closing? Definitely. But we're not building for revolution. Here's the thing about stacked GPU clusters and row after row of industrial sewing machines: Morning render, afternoon runway, midnight already onto the next, and we sleep when that 'why not?', unfuckwithable joy runs dry. Echoes of Berghain. Is it too late? Maybe. AVANTGARDE 17: UNOFFICIAL FASHION WEEK, NORTH PIPE ZONE. HOLD YOUR TOKENS.
